Requirement: The Consortia system shall comply with the IT Department security and privacy standards that are followed by KFUPM systems.
The Consortia system shall allow users to communicate through the system.
The Consortia system’s communication platform shall have timed communication between all parties.
The Consortia system’s communication platform shall have tracked communication between all parties.
The Consortia system shall provide a dashboard showing status of agreements and the resulting outcomes.
The Consortia system shall provide notifications for users to complete their tasks.
The Consortia System shall provide user authentication.
The Consortia System shall implement role based access control.
The Consortia System shall offer the ability to create consortia agreements.
The Consortia System shall offer the ability to manage consortia agreements.
The Consortia System shall maintain version control for agreement documents.
The Consortia System shall enable resource sharing among consortia members.
The Consortia system shall have an uptime of 99.9%.
The Consortia system shall have a standardized interface that enables new users to achieve basic competency with no more than 2 hours of training.
The Consortia system shall provide accurate and timely information.
The Consortia system must be compatible with existing IT infrastructure at KFUPM.
The Consortia system should be scalable to accommodate the growth of consortia activities.
The system shall have a mechanism to facilitate the formation of committees.
The system shall provide tools for defining and managing research themes.
The system shall allow for the detailed specification of technical side related to research themes and committee operations.
The system shall provide a visible approval process, indicating the status and notifying the users of pending approvals.
The system shall track the time spent by each team/party to review the agreement.
The system shall allow KFUPM to invite different organizations for a consortium.
The system shall give the invited user the ability to create an account.
The system shall auto compute scores based on the input of the predefined criteria.
The system shall allow the reviewers to input their assessment.
The system shall incorporate an automated email notification feature.
The consortium system shall allow users from KFUPM to sign in with their KFUPM accounts.
The system shall send an email “invitation” to the reviewer to evaluate the proposal.
The system should restrict the reviewer’s access to a specific time duration.
If 48 hours are left in the duration of revision, the system must send a formal reminder to the reviewer through Email & SMS.
The system shall allow the office review to evaluate the submitted proposals with scores.
If the office review accepts the proposal, the system must pass the proposal to the technical review.
Once the duration of the technical review ends, the system passes the proposal and its technical review results to the technical committee.
The system shall allow the admin to create a new user account.
The system shall allow users to submit a proposal.
The system shall allow the office review to send the evaluated proposals to the technical committee.
The system shall allow the technical committee to give second score to the proposal.
when the technical committee submit their score, the system shall send the proposal to the “Final approval phase”.
The system shall allow the office review to evaluate the submitted proposals with scores.
The system shall send the approved proposals to the execution phase.
For the establishing agreement phase, the system shall force users to submit the needed tasks.
The system shall allow the execution committee to create a project, a review progress report, and issue any required support contract.
The system shall allow the execution committee to create a progress report.
The system shall allow the execution committee to send a project to the closure committee.
The system shall allow the closure committee to review the final report and project outcomes.
